original: Asplind, Bror Ansgar, fil. dr, rektor, Göteborg, f. 5/2/90 i Norrköp. av Carl Gustaf A. o. Augusta Andersson. G. 14 m. Greta Nilsson. Barn: Arne o. Birgit ff. 15, Gudrun 29. — Studiex. i Norrköp. 09, stud. v. Stlilms högsk. 09, fil. mag. 13, fil. lic. 19, fil. dr 29, provår v. södra latin i Sthlm 17. Res. t. Tyskl., Frankr., Belg. o. Danrn. 11, m. statsstip. f. stud. av fysikund :visn. i Tyskl. samt stud. i Frankr. o. Danm. 21, Norge 22, 26 o. 43, Danm. 26, Tyskl. 28, Österr., Ungern o. Tjeckoslov. 30, Finl., Ryssl., Schweiz o. Ital. 35-36. Vik. adj. i Sundsvall 14-16, Falun 16- 18, adj. i Lidingö 18-19, lektor i ma-tem. o. fysik v. Karlstads folksk:sem. 19, rektor v. Luleå folksk:sem. 38-43 o. v. Gbgs dito sed. 43. Vik. und:-visn:råd 31. Led. av Karlstads folk-sk:styr. 23-35, insp. f. Luleå yrkessk. 39, ordf. i taxindn 30-38. Vet:skapl. solförmörkelseexp. t. Järpen 27, Lun-da-0’bserv. exp. t. Moskva-Leningrad 36, astronomkongr. i Köpenh. 26, Heidelberg 28, Budapest 30, Bern 35, Sthlm 38, Sv:es repr. i Union. astr. internat., komm. f. planeter o. kometer sed. 35. Skr.: Våra grannar i världsrymden (34), vetiskapl. avh. i astron. o. talrika upps. i sv. o. uti. tidskr., medarb. i Astron. Rechen-Inst. i Berlin 16-32. RNO, Ferrnerska priset 26, Wallmarkska belön. 29,’ Wallen-bergs stip. 30.
translated: Asplind, Bror Ansgar, PhD, principal, Gothenburg, b. 5/2/90 in Norrköping, to Carl Gustaf A. and Augusta Andersson. m. 14 years to Greta Nilsson. Children: Arne and Birgit, born in 1915, Gudrun in 1929. Completed high school in Norrköping in 1909, studied at Stilms Högskola in 1909, received a Master's degree in 1913, Licentiate of Philosophy in 1919, PhD in Philosophy in 1929, and completed a one year trial as a teacher at Södra Latin in Stockholm in 1917. Traveled to Germany, France, Belgium, and Denmark as a student on a state scholarship to study physics and astronomy in Germany, France, and Denmark (1921), as well as in Norway (1922, 1926, and 1943), Denmark (1926), Germany (1928), Austria, Hungary, and Czechoslovakia (1930), Finland, Russia, Switzerland, and Italy (1935-1936). Temporary assistant teacher in Sundsvall from 1914-1916 and in Falun from 1916-1918, teacher in Lidingö from 1918-1919, lecturer in mathematics and physics at Karlstad's folk high school from 1919, principal of Luleå's folk high school from 1938-1943 and Gothenburg's folk high school from 1943. Temporary advisory council in 1931. Member of Karlstad's folk high school board from 1923-1935, inspector for Luleå Vocational School in 1939, chairman of taxindn from 1930-1938. Scientific solar eclipse experiment in Järpen in 1927, Lunda Observatory experiment in Moscow-Leningrad in 1936, astronomical congress in Copenhagen in 1926, Heidelberg in 1928, Budapest in 1930, Bern in 1935, and Stockholm in 1938. Sweden's representative in the International Astronomical Union, a committee for planets and comets since 1935. Writings include "Our Neighbors in Space" (1934), scientific dissertation on astronomy, and numerous publications in Swedish and international journals. Contributing member of the Astronomical Rechen-Institute in Berlin from 1916-1932. Received the Royal Order of the North Star, the Ferrnerska Prize in 1926, the Wallmark Prize in 1929, and the Wallenberg Scholarship in 1930.

affiliation.affiliation: International Astronomical Union, Committee for Planets and Comets

award.name: Royal Order of the North Star
